desmoj.core.simulator

Class TimeOperations

  • java.lang.Object
    • desmoj.core.simulator.TimeOperations

  • public final class TimeOperations
extends java.lang.Object
    TimeOperations is an utility class that provides arithmetic operations for the time classes TimeInstant and TimeSpan. It also holds the time settings, i.e. the granularity (epsilon) and the reference time unit.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public static TimeSpan add(TimeSpan a,
                           TimeSpan b)
        Returns a new TimeSpan object representing the sum of the given TimeSpan objects. Note that the simulation will stop immediately if the resulting sum is larger than Long.MAX_VALUE-1 (in the unit of epsilon).
        Parameters:
        a - TimeSpan : TimeSpan a
        b - TimeSpan : TimeSpan b
        Returns:
        TimeSpan : A new TimeSpan as the sum of the TimeSpan parameters

      • add

        public static TimeInstant add(TimeSpan span,
                              TimeInstant instant)
        Returns a new Time Instant determined from the instant passed to this method plus the time span passed to method. In other words, this method determines the instant that is a given span after the instant provided. Note that the simulation will stop immediately if the resulting instant is larger than Long.MAX_VALUE-1 (in the unit of epsilon). The preferred time zone of the result is equal to the preferred time zone of parameter b.
        Parameters:
        span - TimeSpan : The TimeSpan to add...
        instant - TimeInstant : ...to this TimeInstant.
        Returns:
        TimeSpan : A new TimeInstant determined from given TimeInstant plus the given TimeSpan

      • add

        public static TimeInstant add(TimeInstant instant,
                              TimeSpan span)
        Returns a new Time Instant determined from the instant passed to this method plus the time span passed to method. In other words, this method determines the instant that is a given span after the instant provided. Note that the simulation will stop immediately if the resulting instant is larger than Long.MAX_VALUE-1 (in the unit of epsilon). The preferred time zone of the result is equal to the preferred time zone of instant passed to this method.
        Parameters:
        instant - TimeInstant : The TimeInstant, to which...
        span - TimeSpan : ...this TimeSpan will be added
        Returns:
        TimeSpan : A new TimeInstant determined from given TimeInstant plus the given TimeSpan

      • subtract

        public static TimeInstant subtract(TimeInstant instant,
                                   TimeSpan span)
        Returns a new Time Instant determined from the instant passed to this method minus the time span passed to method. In other words, this method determines the instant that is a given span before the instant provided. Note that the simulation will stop immediately if the resulting instant is smaller than 0 (in the unit of epsilon). The preferred time zone of the result is equal to the preferred time zone of instant passed to this method.
        Parameters:
        instant - TimeInstant : The TimeInstant, from which...
        span - TimeSpan : ...this TimeSpan will be subtracted
        Returns:
        TimeSpan : A new TimeInstant determined from given TimeInstant minus the given TimeSpan

      • diff

        public static TimeSpan diff(TimeSpan a,
                            TimeSpan b)
        Returns a new TimeSpan object representing the absolute difference of the given TimeSpan objects.
        Parameters:
        a - TimeSpan : TimeSpan a
        b - TimeSpan : TimeSpan b
        Returns:
        TimeSpan : A new TimeSpan as the absolute difference of the TimeSpan parameters

      • diff

        public static TimeSpan diff(TimeInstant a,
                            TimeInstant b)
        Returns a new TimeSpan object representing the absolute difference of the given TimeInstant objects, i.e. the span of time between the two instants of time. Note that the simulation will stop immediately if the resulting sum is larger than Long.MAX_VALUE-1 (in the unit of epsilon).
        Parameters:
        a - TimeInstant : TimeInstant a
        b - TimeInstant : TimeInstant b
        Returns:
        TimeSpan : A new TimeSpan as the difference of the TimeSpan parameters

      • multiply

        public static TimeSpan multiply(TimeSpan span,
                                double factor)
        Returns a new TimeSpan object representing the product of the given TimeSpan and the factor of type double. Note that the simulation will stop immediately if the resulting product is larger than Long.MAX_VALUE-1 (in the unit of epsilon).
        Parameters:
        span - TimeSpan : The span of time
        factor - double : The scalar factor
        Returns:
        TimeSpan : A new TimeSpan as the product of span and factor

      • multiply

        public static TimeSpan multiply(double factor,
                                TimeSpan span)
        Returns a new TimeSpan object representing the product of the given TimeSpan and the factor of type double. Note that the simulation will stop immediately if the resulting product is larger than Long.MAX_VALUE-1 (in the unit of epsilon).
        Parameters:
        factor - double : The scalar factor
        span - TimeSpan : The span of time
        Returns:
        TimeSpan : A new TimeSpan as the product of span and factor

        Parameters:

        divisor - TimeSpan : The divisor

                              double divisor)

        Parameters:

        divisor - double : The divisor
        Returns:
        TimeSpan : A new TimeSpan as the quotient of divident and divisor

      • getEpsilon

        public static java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit getEpsilon()
        Returns the epsilon value representing the granularity of simulation time for this experiment.
        Returns:
        TimeUnit : The granularity of simulation time

      • getEpsilonSpan

        public static TimeSpan getEpsilonSpan()
        Returns the smallest distinguishable TimeSpan.
        Returns:
        TimeSpan : The smallest distinguishable TimeSpan, i.e. one interval of the epsilon unit

      • getTimeFormatter

        public static TimeFormatter getTimeFormatter()
        Returns the time Formatter. This is a package private method for internal framework use only.

      • getStartTime

        public static TimeInstant getStartTime()
        Returns the TimeInstant when the experiment has started.
        Returns:
        TimeInstant : The point in simulation time, the experiment has started.
